K-Fold Cross Validation
â–ª K-Fold is a well-known form of cross-validation.
â–ª Steps:
1. Partition the dataset into k equal-sized partitions.
2. Select one partition as the validation data.
3. Use the remaining k-1 as the training data.
4. Train the model and determine accuracy from the validation data.
5. Repeat the process k times, selecting a different partition each time for the
validation data.
6. Average the accuracy results.

â–ª Controller: the element of a system within itself or external to the system which controls the plant is called
as a controller. The error signal will be a weak signal and so it has to be amplified and then modified for
better control action.
